rComments: Very good professor. She speaks clearly. She explains herself completely. She doesn't skip steps. But she moves a little on the fast side so you get a lot of examples and explanations, but you have to stay awake and alert to keep up. 50% of exam questions come from the homework.

Prof Vrielink makes every attempt to help students pass this class.  Subject is brutally difficult but she is very helpful and approachable.  She is truely interested in helping students and doing everything get you to pass the course.

This was my second time taking OChem and I think that Alice did a good job teaching the class. If she didn't know the answer to a question, she would find it. 50% of the exams were directly from the homework and the other problems were like homework problems. There really weren't any surprises, OChem is just a hard subject.

50% hwk on the test, if u wana at least pass the test, do all the hmwk and understand and/or memorize them. that way, you can at least get around a B. Lectures no help at all, goes too fast, but at least u know what to skip in the book and what she thinks is important which means that it's going to be on the test. Reading book before class is good.
Try to take another teacher if you can.  Alice is still pretty inexperienced in teaching such a hard class to over 200 students.  Her class is very fair, but very hard.

This class was very difficult because of the subject matter, but Alice is a good teacher.  She wasn't able to cover everything throughly in class, but was very helpful if you went to her office hours.  She teaches straight out of the book and tries to make the class fun.

A good teacher, I got a B. I would have had an A, but the final was freakin' rough!! The other tests were chill tho, like the 50% questions from the homework thing. Make sure you goto all the discussion sections, and be prepared for the quizzes, those points will really help. This class will make you work, O-Chem ain't for babies! Good luck.

It's a hard subject, period, but Ms. Vrielink does a great job at making the tests do-able. Extra points are given on discussion quizzes, so don't miss any sections. Again, this is no easy class, don't expect Gen Chem 1A. But it's not impossible to do well, if you make up your mind to tackle the subject with every bit you have. Good luck!

She is not a teacher. Her tests are very hard and unfairly graded by her horrible TA's. She has an attitude like shes something special, but all her students except the few kissups hate her. Unorganized. Unhelpful. Unclear. If you are not a prodigy in chemistry or are very good at memorization, you have no chance of passing her horrible class!

She teaches straight from the book,2nd midterm average was a 51%,she takes the last few homework problems and puts them on the test, you know the ones she didn't explain and which there are no answers for on the solutions manual!  Vrielink is only teaching for the grant money, she's a biochem specialist! Not an OChem teacher!  Avoid her!  Terrible!

GREAT teacher - clear, organized. She writes on transparencies while lecturing so pace is slow enough to take notes on everything she says. Be careful in copying what she writes-she often makes mistakes and scribbles things out, (and her handwriting isn't the neatest). Makes subject as easy as it can be. 50% of exam questions come straight from hw.

After reading the comments here, I was disturbed that I had to take the class with Alice due to time constraints. But, she has been an excellent teacher, with tests close to easy (half the problems are fthe homework), if you're prepared. She has improved since teaching her first class last quarter, and is always there to lend help if you need it.

HORRIBLE, THE WORST TEACHER TO DAY OR ATLEAST COMPETING FOR IT. EXAMS AREN'T FAIR AND SHE HAS NO SIMPATHY FOR ILLNESS OR PERSONAL TRAGEDIES. SHE SAYS SHE HATES O-CHEM AND THAT IS REFLECTED IN HER GENERAL LACK OF KNOWLEDGE FOR THE SUBJECT!

Wish all teachers were this clear in their lectures and prepared.  Comes to lectures with models that really help students understand the subject matter.  Is very helpful in office hours and approachable with questions during the lectures.  Wonderful teacher!  Works hard to help students understand the material and do well!

You pay lots of $ to go to a UC and to be taught by the best.  She isn't even a professor, she's an affiliate.  She doen't have a clue how to teach.  Her tests are so hard.  She should stay in the dungeon of a lab of hers and crystallography herself till death! Buckle down in this class, it'll consume you whole.
Can you say worst teacher ever?  She is horrible!  She is not clear, makes TONS of mistakes and her lectures are not worth going to.  AVOID VRIELINK!

First time teaching OChem at UCSC.  Difficult time slot being 8am and low attendance as a result.  Did an excellent job trying to bring in biological relevance to the lecture material.  Her exams were difficult but fair.  Very approachable both during the lectures and in office hours.  Excellent review session just prior to the second midterm.
Avoid this teacher like the PLAGUE...

1st time teaching class, always messes up in lecture. Tries hard, always seems nervous/unsure while teaching. Her lectures are just as boring as other o-chem classes but are 90% less helpful. She covers most of the material in the chapter & additional random stuff but warns that you're resonsible for EVERYTHING in the chps! Tests way hard!

If you end up having to take ochem with her..DON'T. She doesn't even know what she is doing and messes up her mechanisms all the time. She doesn't even make her own lecture notes and just copies down what some other prof. did last yr. She expects you to figure out problems that she can't even do.

First time teaching the class, will write incorrect mechanisms on the board ALL THE TIME.  She always has to go back and fix mistakes that students point out on the board. 1st midterm had 40% avg. No cheat sheets allowed, even though all the other ochem teachers used them. She aslo teaches all of the stuff the other ochem classes skip. Boo!
